title: White House Issues Executive Order on International Data Protection
description:
A coming White House Executive Order seeks to protect personal information by preventing the mass transfer of Americans' sensitive data to countries of concern.

The post White House Issues Executive Order on International Data Protection appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Cyber Insights 2024: APIs – A Clear, Present, and Future Danger
description:
The API attack surface is expanding and API vulnerabilities are growing. AI will help attackers find and exploit API vulnerabilities at scale.

The post Cyber Insights 2024: APIs – A Clear, Present, and Future Danger appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: US Bans Trading With Canadian Network Intelligence Firm Sandvine
description:
The US has restricted trade with Canadian company Sandvine for aiding the Egyptian government’s web monitoring operations.

The post US Bans Trading With Canadian Network Intelligence Firm Sandvine appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Hackers Steal Personal Information From Pharma Giant Cencora
description:
Pharmaceutical solutions provider Cencora discloses a cyberattack that resulted in personal information being stolen from its systems.

The post Hackers Steal Personal Information From Pharma Giant Cencora appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: US Government Urges Cleanup of Routers Infected by Russia’s APT28
description:
The US government says Russia’s APT28 group compromised Ubiquiti EdgeRouters to run cyberespionage operations worldwide.

The post US Government Urges Cleanup of Routers Infected by Russia’s APT28 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Is XDR Enough? The Hidden Gaps in Your Security Net
description:
When evaluating XDR, consider its value based on its ability to reduce complexity and improve threat detection and response times.

The post Is XDR Enough? The Hidden Gaps in Your Security Net appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Chinese Cyberspies Use New Malware in Ivanti VPN Attacks
description:
Chinese threat actors target Ivanti VPN appliances with new malware designed to persist system upgrades.

The post Chinese Cyberspies Use New Malware in Ivanti VPN Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Intel Core Ultra vPro Platform Brings New Security Features
description:
Intel announces new and improved security features with the latest vPro platform and Core Ultra processors.

The post Intel Core Ultra vPro Platform Brings New Security Features appeared first on SecurityWeek.
